body:
This bit stood out to me:

```
Caused by: java.lang.SecurityException: setContextClassLoader
        at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinWorkerThread$InnocuousForkJoinWorkerThread.setContextClassLoader(ForkJoinWorkerThread.java:244)
```

I did some research and it looks like this may be related to a change in the security behaviour of the ForkJoinPool in later versions of Java 8. Would you mind trying with an early release of Java 8 to see if that fixes the issue for you? It looks like the change occurred in build 122, so build 121 or earlier should be OK.

References:
- Someone with the same issue: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/21440563/webstart-application-securityexception-setcontextclassloader/21460363#21460363.
- Proposal for Java 8 change on mailing list: http://cs.oswego.edu/pipermail/concurrency-interest/2013-December/012123.html
- Patch to JDK: http://hg.openjdk.java.net/jdk8/jdk8/jdk/diff/e2bdddb8bedf/src/share/classes/java/util/concurrent/ForkJoinPool.java
- Summary of changes for build 122: http://mail.openjdk.java.net/pipermail/jdk8-dev/2013-December/003860.html

issue.title: Better use of AsyncCacheApi in CachedAction

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
## Fixes

Fixes #7615.

## Purpose

Instead of using get-and-set the cache, using getOrElseUpdate.

This way the execution won't happen in a ForkJoinPool thread pool, but instead it will fallback all the way down until Scala AsyncCacheApi implementation which uses the application ExecutionContext. Because of that, ContextClassLoaderInjector won't fail to change the ClassLoader for the executing thread.

This sort of thing also crops up when trying to use `bindFromRequest` in forms (Play 2.6.9).
Please see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47344249, where @marcospereira referenced this issue.

issue.title: Scripted test: Parallel streams use akka FJP threads, not commonPool

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
Fixes #8167
Fixes #7751
Real fix for #7615

This pull request itself is not the fix. The fix is that Play 2.8 upgrades to akka 2.6. Just read [this comment](https://github.com/playframework/playframework/issues/8167#issuecomment-490645264).

If you run this scripted tests with Play 2.7 you will see that also Java's default common pool will be used (and the test will fail):
```
[DEBUG] controllers.HomeController - ForkJoinPool.commonPool-worker-2
```
Starting with Play 2.8 however that will not be the case anymore. No common pool -> no SecurityExceptions anymore :wink: 

(This scripted test is basically a copy of the [`http-backend-netty-channel-options`](https://github.com/playframework/playframework/tree/c0fb84c769ec215cdf1af475e1e426f51d91ed90/dev-mode/sbt-plugin/src/sbt-test/play-sbt-plugin/http-backend-netty-channel-options) test, slightly modified of course)

body:
I finally found time to write a test to confirm `SecurityException` will not be thrown anymore when using `map`, `filter`, etc. on a **parallel** stream within a Play action method. See #9594

However, when using `CompletableFuture.supplyAsync(...)` and `thenxxxAsync` methods you still have to pass an explicit ec, because Java uses the common thread pool for this method by default. There is nothing Play can do about this (it's no an issue with Play actually).

I suggest closing this issue as soon as #9594 got merged.
